doc.desc: Document Type Declaration (DTD) declares what version of HTML is used in the document.
The character encoding of the document.

doc.name: Javascript
doc.desc: A popular programming language that is supported in popular Web browsers and other Web tools.

doc.name: Cascading Style Sheet
doc.desc: CSS allows the separation of presentation from structure

doc.name: Favicon
doc.desc: A file containing one or more small icons, most commonly 16x16 pixels.

doc.name: Image Map
doc.desc: The HTML map element creates a client-side image map.

doc.name: Conditional Comments
doc.desc: Conditional statements interpreted by Microsoft Internet Explorer in HTML source code.

doc.name: Canonical URL
doc.desc: A canonical page is the preferred version of a set of pages with highly similar content.

doc.name: Mobile Compatible
doc.desc: Style sheets for different media types.

doc.name: Apple Touch Icon
doc.desc: An icon for a web application used to represent it when added to the Home screen on iOS.

doc.name: OpenID
doc.desc: OpenID is a safe, faster and easier way to log in to web sites..

doc.name: Open Graph Protocol
doc.desc: Enables any web page to become a rich object in a social graph..

doc.name: OpenSearch
doc.desc: A collection of technologies that allow publishing of search results in a format suitable for syndication and aggregation.

doc.name: GeoURL
doc.desc: GeoURL is a location-to-URL reverse directory.

doc.name: Yadis
doc.desc: Yadis is a communications protocol for discovery of services such as OpenID, OAuth, and XDI connected to a Yadis ID.

doc.name: Restricted to Adults
doc.desc: RTA enables parental filtering and work to enforce the prevention of children from viewing age inappropriate content.

doc.name: Creative Commons
doc.desc: Creative Commons licenses provide a flexible range of protections and freedoms for authors, artists, and educators.

doc.name: X-Frame-Options
doc.desc: Indicates whether or not a browser should be allowed to render a page in a frame or iframe.

doc.name: PURL
doc.desc: A persistent uniform resource locator (PURL) is a Uniform Resource Locator (URL) (i.e. location-based Uniform Resource Identifier or URI) that is used to redirect to the location of the requested Web resource.

doc.name: XHTML Vocabulary
doc.desc: This is a vocabulary collection utilized by XHTML Family.
